servinfo.title: DTC B1034: Driver Air Bag Initiator Circuit Short to Power Circuit

servinfosub.title: Wiring Diagram
servinfosub.ptxt: Refer to DTC B1031: Driver Air Bag Initiator Circuit Resistance High .

attention2.ptxt: Be sure to observe instructions under CAUTION in “Air Bag Diagnostic System Check Flow”.

servinfosub.title: DTC Will Set when
servinfosub.ptxt: The voltage measured at driver air bag initiator circuit is above a specified value for specified time.

ptxt.emph: Step 1: Check whether malfunction is in contact coil and driver air bag (inflator) module or the others.
Step 2: Check driver air bag (inflator) module initiator circuit.
Step 3: Check whether malfunction is in contact coil or driver air bag (inflator) module.

test1.ptxt: With ignition switch OFF, disconnect contact coil connector located under of the steering column.
Check proper connection to contact coil at terminal in “G26” or “G27” connector.

If OK, then connect special tools (B) and (C) to “G26” connector (For vehicle without cruise control system [A]) or special tools (B) and (D) to “G27” connector (for vehicle with cruise control system [B]) disconnected in Step 1).

testgroup.question: With ignition switch ON, is DTC B1034 indicated?

test1.ptxt: With ignition switch OFF, disconnect special tools (B) and (C) or (D) from “G26” or “G27” connector and SDM connector “G47” or “G46” from SDM respectively.
Release Shorting bar in SDM connector inserting release tool (1) included in special tool (A).

Measure voltage between “G47-5” terminal and body ground, and between “G47-6” terminal and body ground [A] or between “G46-1” terminal and body ground, and between “G46-2” terminal and body ground [B].

testgroup.question: With ignition switch ON, is each measured value 4 V or less?

action.ptxt: Substitute a known-good SDM and recheck.
“GRN/RED” circuit or “GRN” circuit shorted to power supply circuit.

test1.ptxt: With ignition switch OFF, disconnect special tools (B) and (C) or (D) from “G26” or “G27” connector and reconnect contact coil connector located under of the steering column.
Remove driver air bag (inflator) module from steering column referring to Driver Air Bag (Inflator) Module Removal and Installation .
Check proper connection to driver air bag (inflator) module connector.
If OK, then connect special tools (A), (B) and (E) to driver air bag (inflator) module connector.

testgroup.question: With ignition switch ON, is DTC B1034 indicated?

action.ptxt: Turn ignition switch OFF. Replace contact coil assembly referring to Contact Coil Cable Assembly Removal and Installation .
Turn ignition switch OFF. Replace driver air bag (inflator) module referring to Driver Air Bag (Inflator) Module Removal and Installation .

attention3.ptxt: Upon completion of inspection and repair work, perform the following items.

item.ptxt: Reconnect all air bag system components and ensure all components are properly mounted.
Clear DTCs referring to DTC Clearance , if any.
Repeat Air Bag Diagnostic System Check to confirm that the trouble has been corrected.
